Police department is exactly behind the rec and they have campus police patrolling the campus at night.
The Greek life is great people look forward to the Greek life in college.
Focused Finding theirselves Able to adapt to new things
Siuc is in a small town which makes it hard you to feel as if you're alone.
Go to all the Greek life events Parties Clubbing RSO events Rec Student Center

There's a couple dining halls on campus. They serve some of the same things everyday but also have different food. Most of the food is good for the most part. The dining halls are very clean so you won't have to worry about that.
The dorms are big and spacious. Vey nice RAs and residents on each floor. You halve washer and dryers on each floor and a pool table and flat screen tvs in the lobby.
Academia may seem hard and you may fall behind but if you just do the work you'll do great.
Know what you want Come in and don't mess around Do all your work Attend study sessions Get involved on campus
Carbondale is a very big school. They are good with financial aid and have a large amount of colleges within. The environment is great and everyone would love it here.

TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {235887=In fall of 2012 I will be moving in to Schneider in the East Campus towers. I have met my roommate for the fall and we get along great! I'm really looking forward to the independence and responsibility that goes along with moving out and living at school. The towers are set up so that each room is a suite joined by a bathroom with the room next to it. This makes things feel a lot more private as opposed to having a communal shower facility., 584032=As a Resident Assistant for 3 years, and a Resident for 1 years, Residence Hall Life has been quite an undertaking with changes happening each year. Living Learning Communities are a must for potential applicants and help network very quickly in the environment that you live in and could help you make life long friends in your field. Residence Hall Life has also started on becoming more inclusive to the LGBTQ community and will have a Pride floor starting in Fall 2014 for potential students who are allies or identify., 207919=The classrooms are not huge but they are not small. The lectors have mandatory small groups in which the TA teaches what you are learning in class, but in a smaller classroom. The teacher to student ratio is about 20:1 in small groups., 95135=All of October, SIUC students celebrate Halloween by dressing up every weekend and go out and have fun. It is great seeing people dress up as different stuff every week. The weekend before Halloween it is called Unofficial and that is when most people go out in costumes to have a great time., 575318=I live in the towers (Schneider Hall) which houses hundreds of students. In this environment it is often loud throughout the night and during days. The RA's do travel from floor to floor to make sure nothing too distracting is happening but students often learn the times they come and avoid being loud at these times. Another inconvenience is that there are no security cameras in the hallways. This has allowed many fire alarms to be pulled at all times during the night, this has become a trend in all three towers during the 2013-2014 school year., 533315=I have not run into extremely hard academics yet at Southern Illinois University, and I am a senior. textAfterTable: Am enjoying being here I love here in Carbondale, although the stores and other place where big events are held are long distances away it's fun here. I do recommend a car, but the campus bus is also a good alternative to. I joined the Best dance team on campus Anarki 3D3 and we have been having a great year. They are like my family. Am learning a lot I am a current student at SIUC this is my second year here. I'm majoring in Engineering and while attending siuc, i have been able to focus in more on my major as well getting to know my limitations and how independent I am. The people i met here are fun and outgoing and are becoming to be my best friends here. The teachers are good but some teachers do need that extra mile, meaning you have to work with them and let them know what you are here for and u don't plan on wasting any time.
